university_name: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey - Newark

sources.data_found: Amarel Resources: Confirms the presence of a 'General Access' partition accessible to all Rutgers researchers (including students) and 'Owner' partitions. Lists hardware generations including P100, V100, and newer A100 nodes.
2022 Completions for Rutgers-Newark Computer & Information Sciences: 236 Bachelor's degrees, 54 Master's degrees awarded.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate count derived from Rutgers OIRAP Fall 2023 enrollment data for Newark campus (School 21 + School 62) majoring in Computer Science (Code 198). Graduate count (MS) from Graduate School-Newark (School 26). PhD count is estimated at 30, as the Rutgers CS PhD program is often administered jointly or has smaller specific enrollment data at the Newark campus level compared to New Brunswick. OpenAI was unable to retrieve specific counts.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Some workstation nodes in engineering labs may contain these, but not part of the central Amarel cluster specs.

gpu_resources.notes: GPU counts are for the 'Amarel' cluster, which is the central Rutgers University research computing resource managed by OARC. While physically located primarily at the New Brunswick data center, these resources are explicitly shared and accessible to Rutgers-Newark students and faculty. Exact counts are estimated from OARC '160+ GPUs' statements and typical node configurations found in documentation (e.g., 10 nodes x 4 A100, 16 nodes x 4 V100, 30 nodes x 2 P100). OpenAI was unable to retrieve specific GPU specs.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI and Gemini models. Student counts are specific to the Newark campus, while GPU resources reflect the system-wide OARC 'Amarel' cluster available to Newark students.
